there is no scientific evidence to suggest that the experience of speaking in tongues can be replicated through technology or other means. as such, it is unlikely that this would be viewed as a legitimate expression of faith by those who believe that the experience must come from a spiritual source. however, for those who believe that the experience can be induced through specific techniques, the use of technology or other means may be seen as a valid way to achieve this experience. ultimately, the legitimacy of any expression of faith depends on the beliefs and practices of the individual or religious community involved.
